title: 111_s3085
content: The "Rural Access to Credit Act of 2010" may be cited as the short title. This Act pertains to business and industry direct and guaranteed loans. The "Rural Access to Credit Act of 2010" focuses on amending tangible equity requirements and general terms for direct and guaranteed loans under the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act. The amendments include using commercial lending standards for equity requirements and setting a maximum loan guarantee amount until December 31, 2011. The "Rural Access to Credit Act of 2010" guarantees up to 90% of a business and industry loan up to $10,000,000 for high priority projects until December 31, 2011. Starting January 1, 2012, the guarantee may be up to 80 or 90% for the same loan amount and project priority. The "Rural Access to Credit Act of 2010" guarantees up to 90% of a business and industry loan up to $10,000,000 for high priority projects. The Secretary will guarantee line-of-credit loans and allow refinancing of existing debt for viable projects that create or save jobs. The "Rural Access to Credit Act of 2010" allows refinancing of existing debt for projects that create or save jobs, with certain eligibility criteria such as current loan status and improved loan terms. Subordinated owner debt is not eligible for inclusion in the refinancing. The "Rural Access to Credit Act of 2010" allows refinancing of existing debt for projects that create or save jobs, with eligibility criteria for loans under $1,000,000 exempt from audited financial statements requirement. Delinquency rates for business and industry loans are calculated for accurate comparison among Federal agencies. The "Rural Access to Credit Act of 2010" prioritizes the rural microentrepreneur assistance program in allocating discretionary funds of the Secretary of Agriculture. Budgetary effects of the Act will comply with the Statutory Pay-As-You-Go-Act of 2010. The Chairman of the Senate Budget Committee can submit a statement for printing in the Congressional Record before the vote on passage.
